means: 公映的新影片，发布的新闻[消息]

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"解放，释放"之意。
means: free ： 指不再受任何限制、约束、阻碍和压迫，完全可按自己的意志行事。
liberate ： 常指从束缚和压迫中解放出来，强调获得最终的解放，有时可和free换用。
release ： 侧重指放松限制、解除监禁或免除义务。
discharge ： 强调把某人或某物从监禁、束缚中释放出来。

word_mean: 将具有特定性状的生物体向自然界引入的过程。
电信业务运载设备或交换通道从忙状态变换到空闲状态的动作。

sentence.Network_en: Acupressure is used to release tension spots in the shoulders and neck.
sentence.Network_cn: 指压按摩用于缓解肩部和颈部的紧张。

sentence.Network_en: He still had a lot of pent-up anger to release.
sentence.Network_cn: 他还有很多强压的愤怒要发泄。

sentence.Network_en: Her kidnapper successfully extorted a £75,000 ransom for her release.
sentence.Network_cn: 绑匪成功地勒索了7.5万英镑才将她释放。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French reles (noun), relesser (verb), from Latin relaxare 'stretch out again, slacken' (see relax)

entry.def: If a person or animal is released from somewhere where they have been locked up or looked after, they are set free or allowed to go.

example.ex: He was released from custody the next day...
example.tran: 第二天他被从拘留所里放了出来。

example.ex: He is expected to be released from hospital today...

entry.def: When someone is released, you refer to their release .

example.ex: He called for the immediate release of all political prisoners.
example.tran: 他要求立即释放所有政治犯。

example.ex: ...the secret negotiations necessary to secure hostage releases...
example.tran: 为确保人质释放而要进行的秘密谈判

entry.def: If someone or something releases you from a duty, task, or feeling, they free you from it.

example.ex: Divorce releases both the husband and wife from all marital obligations to each other...
example.tran: 离婚解除了夫妻双方相互之间所有的婚姻义务。

example.ex: This releases the teacher to work with individuals who are having extreme difficulty.
example.tran: 这使得教师可以专门辅导学习特别吃力的学生。

entry.tran: 发泄，释放(情感);展示(能力)
entry.def: To release feelings or abilities means to allow them to be expressed.

example.ex: Becoming your own person releases your creativity...
example.tran: 保持自己的本色才有助于发挥自身创造力。

example.ex: I personally don't want to release my anger on anyone else...
example.tran: 我个人并不想把自己的愤怒发泄在别人身上。

entry.def: If someone in authority releases something such as a document or information, they make it available.

example.ex: They're not releasing any more details yet...
example.tran: 他们还未公布更多细节。

example.ex: Figures released yesterday show retail sales were down in March.
example.tran: 昨天公布的数据显示零售额在3月份有所下滑。

entry.def: If you release someone or something, you stop holding them.

example.ex: He stopped and faced her, releasing her wrist.
example.tran: 他停下来面对着她，放开了她的手腕。

example.ex: ...the twisting action before a bowler releases the ball.
example.tran: 投球手掷球前的屈身动作

entry.tran: 打开，放开，松开(制动装置)
entry.def: If you release a device, you move it so that it stops holding something.

example.ex: Wade released the hand brake and pulled away from the curb.
example.tran: 韦德松开手刹驶离路边。

entry.tran: 释放，放出，排放(气体、热量或某种物质)
entry.def: If something releases gas, heat, or a substance, it causes it to leave its container or the substance that it was part of and enter the surrounding atmosphere or area.

example.ex: ...a weapon which releases toxic nerve gas...
The contraction of muscles uses energy and releases heat...
example.tran: 肌肉的收缩消耗能量并且释放热量。

entry.tran: 发行，推出(唱片、碟片或电影)
entry.def: When an entertainer or company releases a new CD, video, or film, it becomes available so that people can buy it or see it.

example.ex: He is releasing an album of love songs.
example.tran: 他即将推出一张情歌专辑。

entry.tran: 新发行的影片;新片;新碟;发行物
entry.def: A new release is a new CD, video, or film that has just become available for people to buy or see.

example.ex: Which of the new releases do you think are really good?
example.tran: 在这些新片中你觉得哪些真的不错？

entry.tran: (影片的)上映，公映；（录像带的）发行
entry.def: If a film or video is on release or on general release, it is available for people to see in public cinemas or for people to buy.

example.ex: The video has sold three million copies in its first three weeks on release.
example.tran: 影碟推出的前3周就卖出了300万张。

means.word_mean: 1. merchandise issued for sale or public showing (especially a record or film);

sentences.sentence: "a new release from the London Symphony Orchestra"

means.word_mean: 2. the act of liberating someone or something
3. a process that liberates or discharges something;

sentences.sentence: "there was a sudden release of oxygen"
"the release of iodine from the thyroid gland"

means.word_mean: 4. an announcement distributed to members of the press in order to supplement or replace an oral presentation
5. the termination of someone's employment (leaving them free to depart)
6. euphemistic expressions for death;
7. a legal document evidencing the discharge of a debt or obligation
8. activity that releases or expresses creative energy or emotion;

sentences.sentence: "she had no other outlet for her feelings"

means.word_mean: 9. the act of allowing a fluid to escape
10. a formal written statement of relinquishment
11. (music) the act or manner of terminating a musical phrase or tone
1. release, as from one's grip;

sentences.sentence: "Let go of the door handle, please!"
"relinquish your grip on the rope--you won't fall"

means.word_mean: 2. grant freedom to; free from confinement
3. let (something) fall or spill a container;
4. eliminate (substances) from the body
5. prepare and issue for public distribution or sale;
6. generate and separate from cells or bodily fluids;

sentences.sentence: "release a hormone into the blood stream"

means.word_mean: 7. make (information) available publication;

sentences.sentence: "release the list with the names of the prisoners"

means.word_mean: 8. part with a possession or right;

sentences.sentence: "I am relinquishing my bedroom to the long-term house guest"

means.word_mean: 9. make (assets) available;

sentences.sentence: "release the holdings in the dictator's bank account"

Sentence.sentence: The company just released an updated version last week, and it'll be utilized in over 50 undergraduate and graduate classrooms this coming school year.

In a press release describing the report, Mr. Annan stressed the need for the negotiations to focus on increasing the flow of money from rich to poor regions to help reduce their vulnerability to climate hazards while still curbing the emissions of the heat-trapping gases.
The report, to be released Friday, analyzed data and existing studies of health, disaster, population and economic trends.
A 2012 press release from Statistics Sweden bears the title "Gender Equality in Sweden Treading(踩)Water" and notes: 1、The total income from employment for all ages is lower for women than for men

If the collapse of the rain forests speeds up dramatically,it could eventually release 3.5-5 billion metric tons of carbon into the atmosphere each year - making forests the leading source of greenhouse gases.
It is estimated that 25% of all methane that released into the atmosphere coming from farm animals.

means.word_mean: 释放; 放开

sentences.en: Release the dog.He has been chained up for hours.
sentences.cn: 把狗放开, 它已被拴了好几个钟头了。

sentences.en: He released me from my torments.

means.word_mean: 发布; 发行; 发售

sentences.cn: 委员会公布了调查结果。

sentences.en: When is the best moment to release the date of the election to the newspapers?
sentences.cn: 什么时候是向报界透露选举日期的最好时机?

means.word_mean: 减轻(痛苦等)；解脱

sentences.en: A bottle of sleeping tablets will release you from your sufferings forever.
sentences.cn: 一瓶安眠药片将永远解除你的痛苦。

means.word_mean: 准许…离职度假

sentences.en: The manager released him to return to his native town to visit his grandmother who was ill in bed.
sentences.cn: 经理准许他休假回老家探视染病在床的祖母。

means.word_mean: 释放, 排放, 解除

sentences.en: After my examination I had a feeling of release.
sentences.cn: 考完试后我有如释重负之感。

means.word_mean: 释放令

sentences.en: The warden of the prison signed the release.

means.word_mean: 公映的新影片, 发布的新闻[消息]

sentences.en: On this show they played the latest release.
sentences.cn: 这次公演, 他们放映了最新的影片。

jushi.english: The nurse is released from seven o'clock.
The new trade figures have just been released.
jushi.chinese: 新的贸易数字刚刚公布。
